title: Hearty Lentil Stew with Creamy Mashed Potatoes
promptIMG: Professional food photography prompt: "Hearty lentil stew served in a rustic bowl with creamy mashed potatoes on the side, natural food photography, balanced sharp focus throughout entire image, zero blur, infinite depth of field, realistic food textures, modern kitchen background in sharp focus, natural window lighting, kitchen countertop visible, even focus distribution, documentary food photography style, professional food styling, appetizing presentation --no blur, depth of field, bokeh, over-sharpening, artificial enhancement --quality 2 --ar 4:3 --stylize 300"
description: Warm up with this cozy lentil stew and creamy mashed potatoes! Packed with hearty lentils, fresh veggies, and warming spices, it's a satisfying dish for chilly nights. Save this recipe for later and enjoy a bowl of comfort!
ingredients: 2 cups mashed potatoes (prepared with Kerrygold butter and cream)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery, cooking for about 5 minutes until softened.
Stir in minced garlic, cumin, and smoked paprika. Cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add rinsed lentils and vegetable broth to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes or until lentils are tender.
While the stew simmers, prepare your mashed potatoes using Kerrygold butter and cream for that creamy texture.
Once lentils are tender, season the stew with salt and pepper. Serve hot, topped with fresh parsley, alongside the creamy mashed potatoes.
tips:
Listen, making lentil stew is all about balance and flavor. Here are some tips to nail it:

1. **Texture is key**: If you want a thicker stew, let it simmer uncovered for the last 5 minutes, allowing some liquid to evaporate. My ancient cast iron skillet holds heat well, so it works great.

2. **Spice it up**: Don't be shy with your spices! I like to double the cumin for an extra kick, but you can start with the original amount and adjust to your taste.

3. **Storage magic**: This stew keeps well in the fridge for about 3-4 days. Just reheat gently on the stove. If it thickens too much, add a splash of broth!

4. **Make ahead**: You can prep the veggies a day in advance. Just chop them up and store in the fridge. Less work when itâ€™s time to cook!

5. **Different oils**: If you're low on olive oil, feel free to use canola or avocado oil. Both work well and won't change the flavor much.
